content:
• Wednesday, April 11, 2012
  • MCK

    McKesson (NYSE:MCK) confirms the Department of Veterans Affairs has selected the company to...

    McKesson (NYSE:MCK) confirms the Department of Veterans Affairs has selected the company to continue as its prime pharmaceutical supplier. The two-year agreement calls for MCK to supply all of the VA's medical centers and outpatient clinics, as well as its Consolidated Mail Outpatient Pharmacies. Shares +4.5% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:26 PM | 1 Comment
  • AVID

    Avid Technology (NASDAQ:AVID) has resumed trading following its Q1 warning, and is currently...

    Avid Technology (NASDAQ:AVID) has resumed trading following its Q1 warning, and is currently down 18.2% AH. With Avid specifically blaming weakness in "creative enthusiast" solutions, questions about further market share losses at the hands of cheaper products such as Adobe's (NASDAQ:ADBE) Premiere Pro and Apple's (NASDAQ:AAPL) Final Cut Pro are bound to be raised.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:16 PM
  • QRVO

    Power amplifier vendor RF Micro Devices (RFMD -2.9%) is among the casualties of Nokia's...

    Power amplifier vendor RF Micro Devices (RFMD -2.9%) is among the casualties of Nokia's (NYSE:NOK) Q1 warning, and so might (to a lesser extent) Lumia chip supplier Qualcomm (QCOM unchanged) Less affected is baseband/power management chip supplier (TXN +0.9%): though its March guidance cut was almost certainly Nokia-influenced, the fact TI is winding down its baseband ops limits the impact of Nokia's woes. (more)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:01 PM | 1 Comment
  • AMCC

    Applied Micro Circuits (AMCC +8.3%) opened lower thanks to its FQ4 warning, but quickly reversed...

    Applied Micro Circuits (AMCC +8.3%) opened lower thanks to its FQ4 warning, but quickly reversed course and closed with a heady gain. Fellow telecom chipmaker Cavium (CAVM) rallied in much the same way last week following its warning - the moves are likely evidence that some beaten-down chip names are pricing in a lot of bad news.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:49 PM
  • LEA

    Lear (NYSE:LEA) acquires Guilford Mills, a privately-held company that manufactures fabrics for...

    Lear (NYSE:LEA) acquires Guilford Mills, a privately-held company that manufactures fabrics for the automotive and specialty markets. Financial terms of the deal were not disclosed. Guilford has strong relationships with virtually all of the major global automakers, with 85% of its annual profits coming from automotive applications and annual sales of approximately $400M. Shares +2% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:39 PM
  • MU

    Micron (NASDAQ:MU) -1.5% AH after announcing an $870M convertible note offering. The chipmaker,...

    Micron (NASDAQ:MU) -1.5% AH after announcing an $870M convertible note offering. The chipmaker, which had $2.3B in debt on its balance sheet as of March 1, only says it will use the proceeds for capped call transactions and "general corporate purposes." Might one of those purposes be a bid for Elpida?

     
     
     
     
    | 4:27 PM
  • RCPI

    Star Scientific (CIGX +11.2%), a developer of technology that aims to reduce the health impact...

    Star Scientific (CIGX +11.2%), a developer of technology that aims to reduce the health impact of tobacco, soared in the final hour of trading. The apparent trigger is the USPTO's approval of a Star patent related to a tobacco curing process that can prevent the formation of a carcinogen. The company is mired in litigation with R.J. Reynolds.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:17 PM | 2 Comments
  • KIOR

    KiOR (KIOR +10.8%) shares spike as Cowen & Co. says the renewable fuels company should...

    KiOR (KIOR +10.8%) shares spike as Cowen & Co. says the renewable fuels company should complete construction of its first commercial plant, in Columbus, Miss., near the end of Q2, with production in H2 being "a bigger trigger" for the stock. Piper Jaffray reiterates its Overweight rating and $20 price target after a field trip to the construction site.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:51 PM
  • DLX

    Shares of Deluxe (DLX +2.5%) are raised to Buy from Neutral at DA Davidson, as they slip into...

    Shares of Deluxe (DLX +2.5%) are raised to Buy from Neutral at DA Davidson, as they slip into "attractive territory" after a ~20% drop since a February peak. "As the shares diverged from market indices, [the firm] believe[s] the company has been strengthening its fundamental market position."
     
     
     
     
    | 3:45 PM
  • ARBA

    Goldman says M&A is poised to see an uptick in activity. Companies with the highest...

    Goldman says M&A is poised to see an uptick in activity. Companies with the highest probability for a takeout in small-caps are: Ariba (ARBA +0.9%), Onyx Pharmaceuticals (ONXX +2.4%), and Synchronoss (SNSS +3.1%).

     
     
     
     
    | 3:43 PM
  • MNTX

    Shares of Manitex International (MNTX +16.9%) shoot higher after the company announces a record...

    Shares of Manitex International (MNTX +16.9%) shoot higher after the company announces a record backlog of $133M for its products as of the end of Q1. Demand for the firm's boom truck cranes led the charge in orders.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:38 PM
  • DRYS

    Shippers are seeing strong upside in today's trade, as reports suggest many carriers are...

    Shippers are seeing strong upside in today's trade, as reports suggest many carriers are dropping anchor until rates increase further and Alcoa's earnings surprise may indicate a more accelerated global shipping recovery. DRYS +8.2%, FRO +3.1%, NEWL +72%, FREE +12.1%, EGLE +5.6%, DSX +2%, TNK +3%.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:37 PM | 1 Comment
  • JVA

    Shares of Coffee Holdings (JVA +10.1%) pull out a double-digit gain as one of the favored...

    Shares of Coffee Holdings (JVA +10.1%) pull out a double-digit gain as one of the favored targets of speculators and short sellers continues to bounce on momentum swings more than news. Shares of JVA are up 76% over the last 52-weeks, although that includes a dizzying trip up to over $30 last summer and back down below $10 by fall.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:31 PM
  • CREE

    Heavily-shorted Cree (CREE +5.4%) is rallying for the second day in a row after announcing a...

    Heavily-shorted Cree (CREE +5.4%) is rallying for the second day in a row after announcing a low-cost LED streetlight solution. Today's move comes in spite of bearish commentary from Raymond James: while the firm expects Cree to post FQ3 results on April 17 that are roughly in-line with guidance, it thinks investors are too optimistic about the company's operating leverage, and doubts its gross margin, which stood at 35.3% in FQ2, will ever return to the mid-40s.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:26 PM | 1 Comment
  • SKUL

    Skullcandy (SKUL +2.8%) moves higher today after announcing a multi-platform alliance with The...

    Skullcandy (SKUL +2.8%) moves higher today after announcing a multi-platform alliance with The Berrics, a world-renowned indoor skate park and one of the the most popular websites in skateboarding. The partnership will integrate SKUL products and branding on theberrics.com as well as in its new skate park and offices, which are slated to open later this year.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:16 PM
  • BTX

    BioTime (BTX -9.3%) shares sink after a Seeking Alpha article by Martin Shkreli says the biotech...

    BioTime (BTX -9.3%) shares sink after a Seeking Alpha article by Martin Shkreli says the biotech smallcap is worth ~$20M vs. its current ~$221M market cap. "With only $22M in cash and limited operations... BioTime has a need for raising cash in the future... I predict BTX shares will drop at least 50% in the next 12 months."

     
     
     
     
    | 2:59 PM | 2 Comments
  • NOK

    As Nokia (NOK -14.4%) falls to levels last seen in the late '90s thanks to its Q1/Q2 warning (I,...

    As Nokia (NOK -14.4%) falls to levels last seen in the late '90s thanks to its Q1/Q2 warning (I, II, III), analysts caution the worst is yet to come. Nomura fears Q2 could be even worse than guidance suggests, and Q3 weaker still. Bernstein, meanwhile, warns the "feature phone" market is disappearing thanks to the adoption of low-cost Android phones. CEO Stephen Elop says he'll consider "asset sales" and other options; could Nokia's patent portfolio be in play?
     
     
     
     
    | 2:56 PM | 6 Comments
  • CVGW

    Calavo Growers (CVGW +2.7%) holds on to gains after Wedbush initiated the shares with an...

    Calavo Growers (CVGW +2.7%) holds on to gains after Wedbush initiated the shares with an Outperform rating earlier today. Wedbush says the grower is market leader in the avacado industry, and has a solid distribution network to support its burgeoning fresh foods business. The stock should be trading at a 20% premium to its peers, and the firm gives it a 12-month price target of $34.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:55 PM
  • AAV-OLD

    Advantage Oil & Gas (AAV-OLD -3.4%) continues to languish after BMO Capital cut its rating...

    Advantage Oil & Gas (AAV-OLD -3.4%) continues to languish after BMO Capital cut its rating to Underperform earlier today, saying that natural gas oversupply will cause the company, without yield support, to lag the rest of the E&P market.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:42 PM | 1 Comment
  • PVAC

    Penn Virginia (PVA +8.6%) pops after being upgraded to Add on valuation by Capital One earlier...

    Penn Virginia (PVA +8.6%) pops after being upgraded to Add on valuation by Capital One earlier today, after the company affirmed its intention to sell assets and pay down its credit facility. The decision relieves liquidity concerns that have been an overhang on the stock.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:33 PM
  • SVU

    Supervalu (SVU +6.1%) extends a two-day rally on the back of its solid earnings beat yesterday,...

    Supervalu (SVU +6.1%) extends a two-day rally on the back of its solid earnings beat yesterday, and further fueled by what Cantor considers to be a short squeeze. The firm notes that underlying improvement in the company's customer count and volume trends are encouraging, and ultimately should help alleviate some of the damage the stock has suffered this year.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:13 PM
  • JAGGF

    Shares of Jaguar Mining (JAG -23.1%) plunge on heavy trading volume after DealReporter breaks...

    Shares of Jaguar Mining (JAG -23.1%) plunge on heavy trading volume after DealReporter breaks out a story that Shandong Gold has lost interest in snapping up the company.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:11 PM | 3 Comments
  • CLNE

    Shares of Clean Energy (CLNE +5.1%) trade higher and threaten the $20 barrier - but that could...

    Shares of Clean Energy (CLNE +5.1%) trade higher and threaten the $20 barrier - but that could just be the start of a possible run to $200, according to SA author Philip Mause. He cites the "unprecedented" gap between oil and natural gas prices and growing demand for Clean Energy's products as forces that could bring the company profits of $13.80 a share.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:53 PM
  • CMRE

    Greek shipper Costamare (CMRE +5.5%) jumps on positive comments out of Morgan Stanley this...

    Greek shipper Costamare (CMRE +5.5%) jumps on positive comments out of Morgan Stanley this morning. The firm says large container vessel rates are on the verge of recovering, and CMRE - relatively immune to short-term rate fluctuations as the majority of its vessels are tied to long-term contracts - should move higher.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:43 PM
  • ARNA

    Arena Pharmaceuticals (ARNA +6.6%) trades higher amid a bit of overwrought Internet drama. A...

    Arena Pharmaceuticals (ARNA +6.6%) trades higher amid a bit of overwrought Internet drama. A group of shareholders filed a Cease-and-Desist Letter (.pdf) to TheStreet's Adam Feuerstein after he wrote that the firm's weight-loss drug Lorcaserin "isn't much more than a placebo" and causes tumors in rats.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:28 PM | 24 Comments
  • BKS

    Shares of Barnes & Noble (BKS -5.2%) fall off after the DoJ settles with publishers Simon &...

    Shares of Barnes & Noble (BKS -5.2%) fall off after the DoJ settles with publishers Simon & Schuster, HarperCollins, and Hachette amid its suit against Apple over inflated e-book prices. Analysts don't see the government intervention resulting in higher margins for Barnes & Noble on physical book sales.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:10 PM
  • APKT

    Barclays makes some changes a few VoIP stocks today, upping Acme Packet (APKT +5.2%) to...

    Barclays makes some changes a few VoIP stocks today, upping Acme Packet (APKT +5.2%) to Overweight and initiating Broadsoft (BSFT +4.1%) with an Overweight. The firm says new technologies should drive IP voice traffic "materially higher," and these two stocks have the best leveraged exposure to the shift.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:01 PM
  • CAT

    Rosecliff Capital's Mike Murphy makes the bullish case for Caterpillar (CAT +1.5%) as he calls...

    Rosecliff Capital's Mike Murphy makes the bullish case for Caterpillar (CAT +1.5%) as he calls fears of a China slowdown "overdone." He assigns an earnings multiple of 13 to CAT and calls for a run to $130. It's a take that the Reformed Broker isn't on board with as he says enough money hasn't come out of the space yet.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:52 PM | 1 Comment

  • The SEC charges AutoChina International (AUTCF.OB -17.1%) and 11 investors with conducting a...

    The SEC charges AutoChina International (AUTCF.OB -17.1%) and 11 investors with conducting a market manipulation scheme attempting to create a “false appearance of a liquid and active market” for AUTCF stock. The charge includes a senior executive and director at the China-based firm.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:45 PM
  • EADSY

    Airbus (OTCPK:EADSY +1.6%) says it's entered into a $2.5B deal with Garuda Indonesia to sell 11...

    Airbus (OTCPK:EADSY +1.6%) says it's entered into a $2.5B deal with Garuda Indonesia to sell 11 new aircraft. The purchase is part of Garuda's plans to double its fleet size over the next three years. The planes will be delivered in stages, with the first due in Q4 of 2014.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:36 PM
  • LDK

    LDK Solar (LDK +4.7%) moves up after saying late yesterday that it's delaying the release of its...

    LDK Solar (LDK +4.7%) moves up after saying late yesterday that it's delaying the release of its Q4 results because it needs more time to finalize impairment provisions and certain inventory writedowns. The company will now report its results on April 30, rather than this Thursday as originally planned.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:30 PM
  • AGN

    Watson Pharmaceuticals (WPI +1.3%) is on track to announce a deal to buy Swiss-based Actavis for...

    Watson Pharmaceuticals (WPI +1.3%) is on track to announce a deal to buy Swiss-based Actavis for ~$6B by the end of April, creating one of the world's biggest producers of generic drugs, Reuters reports. Watson believes a move would help it compete more effectively against rivals like Teva and Novartis unit Sandoz.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:23 PM
  • GME

    GameStop (GME -1%) slips on a downgrade to Hold at Needham. The firm cites a lack of near-term...

    GameStop (GME -1%) slips on a downgrade to Hold at Needham. The firm cites a lack of near-term catalysts, and notes that slower retail sales due to the industry's shift to non-retail distribution will continue to put pressure on the company's margins.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:12 PM
  • WTI

    W&T Offshore (WTI +2.4%) ticks up on the back of an upgrade to Buy at Pritchard. The firm...

    W&T Offshore (WTI +2.4%) ticks up on the back of an upgrade to Buy at Pritchard. The firm says the oil and gas driller is poised to gain on the strength of its onshore and offshore asset bases. The company is focused primarily in the Gulf of Mexico area, where it has developed significant technical expertise in areas yielding high production rates.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:03 PM
  • AA

    Alcoa (AA +7.6%) shares are soaring following the company’s Q1 earnings beat, and at least...

    Alcoa (AA +7.6%) shares are soaring following the company’s Q1 earnings beat, and at least three analysts raise earnings estimates for Q2 or FY 2012. But caution persists: Dahlman Rose notes the earnings upside was almost exclusively driven by lower than expected costs, and BMO notes upstream alumina and aluminum segments continue to face energy and input cost pressures.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:59 AM
  • AMSC

    Beaten-down American Superconductor (AMSC +13.7%) soars on a bullish note from Maxim Group....

    Beaten-down American Superconductor (AMSC +13.7%) soars on a bullish note from Maxim Group. Maxim expects the the unpredictable voltage changes produced by wind and solar plants to drive demand for AMSC's grid-management solutions, and thinks a settlement of its lawsuit against ex-customer Sinovel could provide a "surprising lifeline." Earlier this week, AMSC appealed the dismissal of one of its Sinovel suits to China's supreme court.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:54 AM
  • GNW

    Genworth Financial (GNW +4.5%) is started with a Buy rating at BTIG, which says the stock price...

    Genworth Financial (GNW +4.5%) is started with a Buy rating at BTIG, which says the stock price reflects excessive pessimism given GNW's ample liquidity, solid capital position, moderate leverage, adequate reserves and the improving trajectory of its operations. Despite challenges posed by its mortgage insurance unit, the firm believes GNW is on track to return to profitability in 2013.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:47 AM
  • NTAP

    NetApp (NTAP -2.4%) sells off thanks to a downgrade to Sector Perform from FBN. The firm...

    NetApp (NTAP -2.4%) sells off thanks to a downgrade to Sector Perform from FBN. The firm believes NetApp's sales have been weaker than expected due to tough competition, particularly from EMC, whose VNX mid-range line has been doing brisk business. FBN adds some of NetApp's customers are considering opting for cloud solutions, and that resellers indicated NetApp sales are "on the weaker side." (previously)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:38 AM
  • TZOO

    Benchmark's Daniel Kurnos doesn't buy into the Travelzoo (NASDAQ:TZOO)-for-sale rumors based on...

    Benchmark's Daniel Kurnos doesn't buy into the Travelzoo (NASDAQ:TZOO)-for-sale rumors based on his belief a P-E firm wouldn't pay more than $26 a share. He recommends that investors sell if shares rise over $27 and the takeover chatter starts to lose steam. TZOO +22.9% to $25.88.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:37 AM
  • PLCM

    Polycom (PLCM -1.7%) makes new 52-week lows yet again after Barclays downgrades the...

    Polycom (PLCM -1.7%) makes new 52-week lows yet again after Barclays downgrades the videoconferencing hardware maker to Equalweight, and slashes its PT to $15 from $24. RBC downgraded Polycom on Monday in response to the company's Q1 warning, which raised fears of additional share loss to Cisco.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:20 AM
  • NGSX

    Shares of microcap drug developer NeurogesX (NGSX +30%) soar after saying the FDA has accepted...

    Shares of microcap drug developer NeurogesX (NGSX +30%) soar after saying the FDA has accepted its request for a meeting to discuss ongoing clinical studies of NGX-1998, its product candidate for neuropathic pain. Phase 2 studies were completed at the end of 2011.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:04 AM
  • JCP

    J.C. Penney (JCP +2.1%) announces CFO Michael Dastugue will be leaving the company to be...

    J.C. Penney (JCP +2.1%) announces CFO Michael Dastugue will be leaving the company to be replaced on an interim basis by COO Michael Kramer who will assume his duties.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:00 AM | 1 Comment
  • ANRZQ

    Alpha Natural Resources (ANR +5.1%) names its chief commercial officer Paul Vining as president,...

    Alpha Natural Resources (ANR +5.1%) names its chief commercial officer Paul Vining as president, taking the place of 31-year company veteran Kurt Kost, who is retiring. Vining will continue to have responsibility for sales and marketing, as well as taking responsibility for ANR's mining operations.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:53 AM | 1 Comment
  • CCL

    Carnival (CCL +1.7%) affirms its FY12 EPS view of $1.40 - $1.70 at its Annual Shareholder...

    Carnival (CCL +1.7%) affirms its FY12 EPS view of $1.40 - $1.70 at its Annual Shareholder meeting today, adding that it sees "significant" impact on all brands from the Costa crash. Consensus for FY12 EPS is $1.60. (Webcast)
     
     
     
     
    | 10:52 AM
  • PHM

    Home builders rally sharply after Wells Fargo's survey of sales managers says sales rates are at...

    Home builders rally sharply after Wells Fargo's survey of sales managers says sales rates are at their strongest levels since the firm began its survey in 2001. The survey says March pricing improved from February, and 2012 may mark the recovery year for the sector after several false starts. PHM +9.2%, LEN +5.4%, DHI +5.9%, TOL +4.3%.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:42 AM | 4 Comments
  • HCSG

    Healthcare Services Group (HCSG +4%) gains after its Q1 misses on a per share basis but beats on...

    Healthcare Services Group (HCSG +4%) gains after its Q1 misses on a per share basis but beats on revenue. Net earnings rose 10% Y/Y as the nursing-home housekeeping and food-service provider benefitted from a reduction in payroll expenses as well as other cost cutting efforts.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:41 AM
  • PCAR

    Paccar (PCAR -3.7%) unit Kenworth says it will lay off 10% of its workers at a plant in Ohio due...

    Paccar (PCAR -3.7%) unit Kenworth says it will lay off 10% of its workers at a plant in Ohio due to an expected slowdown in production.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:35 AM
  • JWN

    UBS rates the U.S. department store sector with a Neutral view, saying easy early-cycle money...

    UBS rates the U.S. department store sector with a Neutral view, saying easy early-cycle money has already been made, but it starts upscale chain Nordstrom (JWN +1.6%) at Buy with a $63 target price. JWN rivals Macy's (M +1.8%) and Saks (SKS +1%) are started at Neutral, as are mid-priced operators J.C. Penney (JCP +2.5%) and Kohl's (KSS +0.4%).

     
     
     
     
    | 10:31 AM
  • FFIV

    F5 (FFIV -4%) sells off after William Blair says its checks indicate the company's sales force...

    F5 (FFIV -4%) sells off after William Blair says its checks indicate the company's sales force "was aggressive in attempting to close deals in North America" at quarter's end, in contrast to the last 2 quarters. The firm still expects F5 to beat FQ2 estimates when it reports next Wednesday, but thinks results will disappoint the high expectations of investors. Nomura recently aired concerns about F5's competition and pricing policies, though Merrill and Sterne Agee are more positive.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:28 AM
  • PCYC

    Pharmacyclics (PCYC +3.8%) trades higher after the FDA designates Orphan Drug Status for its...

    Pharmacyclics (PCYC +3.8%) trades higher after the FDA designates Orphan Drug Status for its chronic lymphocyctic leukemia treatment.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:26 AM | 1 Comment
  • SLAB

    Silicon Laboratories (SLAB +5.8%) gets a bump higher on an upgrade to Buy at Wunderlich. The...

    Silicon Laboratories (SLAB +5.8%) gets a bump higher on an upgrade to Buy at Wunderlich. The firm says the recent pullback creates a more favorable risk/reward scenario, and the potential upside to its earnings estimates makes the stock attractive at these levels. The firm also upped its price target to $50 from $44. Worth noting: Recent weakness has put the stock at the bottom of a trading range it's held since last November.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:16 AM
  • TSL

    Solar stocks (KWT +4.3%) rally on frenzied momentum buying with Trina Solar (TSL +6.1%), Suntech...

    Solar stocks (KWT +4.3%) rally on frenzied momentum buying with Trina Solar (TSL +6.1%), Suntech Power (STP +9.1%), and First Solar (FSLR +9.6%) leading the charge after reports tip off that DoE funds appear to be flowing into the sector. Was SA author Shareholders Unite correct in calling out a multi-year bottom yesterday with its belief that demand is set to improve?

     
     
     
     
    | 10:11 AM
  • ADTN

    Adtran (ADTN +2.7%) reports a 62% Y/Y drop in profit for its Q1, hurt by higher expenses and a...

    Adtran (ADTN +2.7%) reports a 62% Y/Y drop in profit for its Q1, hurt by higher expenses and a decline in sales, but non-GAAP earnings of $0.25/share and revenues of $134.7M beat analyst expectations. The networking and communications equipment provider also announces a cash dividend for the quarter.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:10 AM
  • LLEN

    L&L Energy (LLEN +7%) signs a long-term sales contract with Guodian Yongfu Power Generation...

    L&L Energy (LLEN +7%) signs a long-term sales contract with Guodian Yongfu Power Generation Co. Under the agreement, LLEN will provide 20,000 tons of thermal coal per month over the next eight months to Yongfu Power, and the contract can be extended. The agreement is expected to generate ~$19M in revenue.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:46 AM
  • TITN

    Titan Machinery (TITN +13.6%) shares soar at the open after reporting its FQ4 earnings jumped a...

    Titan Machinery (TITN +13.6%) shares soar at the open after reporting its FQ4 earnings jumped a higher-than-expected 72% on strong agricultural equipment sales and an improving construction market. TITN also issued upside FY 2013 guidance with EPS of $2.55-$2.75 vs. $2.02 consensus and revenues of $1.95B-$2.1B vs. $1.68B consensus.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:40 AM
  • VMW

    VMware (VMW -5.2%) falls after announcing CFO/co-president Mark Peek is leaving the company to...

    VMware (VMW -5.2%) falls after announcing CFO/co-president Mark Peek is leaving the company to become the CFO of Workday, and co-president Carl Eschenbach is being promoted to the newly-created position of COO. A "selection process" will be launched to find a new CFO. VMware also says it expects its Q1 results to "broadly meet or slightly exceed" prior guidance.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:38 AM
  • BAC

    Bank of America (NYSE:BAC) +2.8% premarket after Guggenheim raises its stock rating to Buy from...

    Bank of America (NYSE:BAC) +2.8% premarket after Guggenheim raises its stock rating to Buy from Neutral in the wake of the pullback in BofA shares after doubling between December and March. The firm forecasts as much as $0.20 in Q1 EPS, the high mark among analysts with consensus EPS at $0.12; mortgage banking will benefit from refinancing activity and dropping net charge-offs.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:29 AM | 1 Comment
  • LVS

    BMO raises its price target on Las Vegas Sands (NYSE:LVS) to $69 from $62 after the company...

    BMO raises its price target on Las Vegas Sands (NYSE:LVS) to $69 from $62 after the company announces it plans to build a "mini Las Vegas" in Spain in front of an expected pickup in gaming demand in the region over the next decade. Shares +1.4% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:25 AM | 2 Comments
  • NOK

    Alcatel Lucent (ALU) +4.5% premarket after Raymond James initiates coverage with a Strong Buy...

    Alcatel Lucent (ALU) +4.5% premarket after Raymond James initiates coverage with a Strong Buy rating and a $4.50 target price. The rating is something of a surprise given the telecom company's string of disappointments and expectations of a breakeven quarter. Nomura cut its target price on ALU yesterday.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:19 AM

  • Market preview: U.S. shares are set to follow much of Europe higher following five days of...

    Market preview: U.S. shares are set to follow much of Europe higher following five days of losses, with S&P Benchmark futures +0.7%. "Verbal pixie dust" from the ECB's Benoit Coeure has sent Spanish and Italian debt yields sharply lower, and stocks higher. Alcoa's (+5.2%) unexpected profit is also helping, although Nokia (-15.5%) is getting slaughtered after a profit warning.
